definition[0]: to cut something roughly or violently
example[0]: Both men had been hacked to death  (=killed using large knives).
example[1]: She hacked away at the ice, trying to make a hole.
example[2]: Whole forests have been hacked down.
example[3]: He hacked his way through the undergrowth.
definition[1]: to secretly find a way of getting information from someone else’s computer or changing information on it
example[4]: He managed to hack the code.
example[5]: Somebody hacked into the company’s central database.
definition[2]: to ride a horse along roads or through the country
definition[3]: to cough in a loud unpleasant way
definition[4]: a writer who does a lot of low-quality work, especially writing newspaper articles
example[6]: A Sunday newspaper hack uncovered the story.
example[7]: The meeting was attended by the usual old party hacks.
definition[6]: a way of using a computer to get into someone else’s computer system without their permission
definition[7]: a taxi, or a taxi driver
definition[8]: an act of hitting something roughly with a cutting tool
example[8]: One more hack and the branch was off.
definition[10]: a horse you can pay money to ride on
example[9]: a long hack across the fields
definition[12]: to secretly reach information on someone else’s computer system so that you can look at, use, or change it
example[10]: The police are investigating a series of computer crimes involving people thought to have hacked confidential databases.
example[11]: He didn’t have to hack into my personal computer to get the information.
definition[13]: a writer who does a lot of low quality work, especially writing newspaper articles
definition[14]: a taxi, or someone whose job is to drive a taxi
